intro: Hydnophytum coriaceum, commonly known as the sticky root epiphyte, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique ability to form symbiotic relationships with certain fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from the air and rain. The plant has a dense, velvety covering of fine hairs that gives it a sticky texture, aiding in capturing moisture and particles. Its roots are specialized for anchoring to host trees and can secrete substances that enhance nutrient uptake. Hydnophytum coriaceum is typically found in humid, shaded environments in Southeast Asia and parts of Africa.
